headline: Fajita Marinade
description: Delicious fajita marinade made with lime juice, olive oil, and soy sauce, and spiced up with cayenne and black pepper. Makes enough marinade for 2 pounds of meat.

video.description: See how to make a 5-star marinade for fabulous steak fajitas.
video.name: Fajita Marinade I

name: Fajita Marinade

recipeInstructions.text: In a large resealable plastic bag, mix together the lime juice, water, olive oil, garlic, soy sauce, salt, and liquid smoke flavoring. Stir in cayenne and black pepper.
Place desired meat in the marinade, and refrigerate at least 2 hours, or overnight. Cook as desired.

review.reviewBody: Omitted the water as others suggested. Added a little bit more lime juice and only marinated my thinly sliced chicken breast for an hour, and it turned out perfect!
Easy and very tasty! Iâ€™ll make this again for sure!
I have been using this recipe for years. Itâ€™s great with chicken and beef. I am currently marinating skirt steak in it right now. Itâ€™s gonna be a good night :) thank you so much!

This is an excellent marinade, particularly if you have the time to do it overnight. When I have less time I add about 50% more lime juice so the acid breaks down the muscle better. The liquid smoke adds just the right amount of outdoor Iâ€™ve used this with all sorts of cuts of beef from flank to sirloin and even a rib steak.
I donâ€™t care for liquid smoke, so I left it out. Big hit! Delicious. I marinated it 2 days ðŸ˜€
Easy and quick to put together. I didn't have liquid smoke. smells delicious!
Followed the recipe and loved it! Used it once with chicken and once with beef. Both times was awesome!

Made chicken fajitas for my Dad's 85th birthday tidy and the whole family LOVED them. I didn't HSBC enough soy sauce so I substituted worchestershire sauce and also added a half teaspoon of Cumin. Grilled and then kept warm in a covered pan in the oven. Delicious!!
You can add little more lime juice if you want it more acidic and have no time to let it overnight. Or just leave it overnight.

This has been my go to fajita marinade for several years now. I add fresh cilantro, then toss my meat in it and let it sit while I cut up my veggies and then put meat and the marinade into a pan and cook until whatever meat is done. I also slice my meat before marinading it. So it's not a whole flank steak, chicken breast, whatever. Which makes it so the marinade penetrates the meat faster. I prefer my veggies sauteed separately with just salt & pepper.
For the amount of salt, I also added equal amount of sugar generously. I didn't add any water. For the liquid smoke, I used smoke paprika instead for the same amount as the cayenne. It was a hit!
This was a fantastic marinade. I got a 1.5 lb london broil on sale and this was the perfect answer. After two hours in frig, threw it on a med high heat cast iron skillet. I'll be using this again!

I love Mexican food. This recipes has resurrected two dishes for my family. Quesadillas and fajitas. I use cooked, left over chicken and shred it with the marinade. I cook some peppers, onions and garlic, add the shredded chicken and voila!
I made it as written, no tweaks, the fajitas were delicious.

I love this marinade. It is a staple in our house. I always omit the water from this recipe. It's not needed and without it the flavors are more enhanced on the meat. We also use flank steak for this recipe.
Delicious without any changes!
It was delicious on meat, veggies and soy curls alike. Thank you!

This is my default fajita marinade, always great. I made it this time with 3 tablespoons of garlic-steeped oil and a bit less water, and no actual garlic, for a guest following a low FODMAP diet. Still very good!
This is our go to fajita marinade. We usually double/triple this recipe to have enough to cover 2lbs of flank steak.
Added 1/4 tsp (or so) of Cumin to it and used breast meat rather than thighs is the only change I made. Sharing this amazing recipe with all my friends!
I didn't use garlic for health issue. Tasted very well and easy to make. Thank you
I used 3 lbs of skirt steak in one large piece. Didn't have fresh lime, only the plastic squeeze lime! My husband grilled it and it was delicious.
Added a bit of red pepper flakes and onion powder. Marinated for 3-4 hrs. Meat was very tender and flavorful.
It is easy and delicious! It seems like it's a bit heavy on lime flavor when you taste it before marinating your meat, but cooking makes the tastes even out correctly. I love it!
This is a great base for meat and chicken (used thighs). Thank you for sharing. I will use this again and again !!
This is the best fajita recipe Iâ€™ve used. I used fresh lemon and lime, as well as Worcestershire sauce in replacement of some of the soy sauce.

delicious flavor!!
I will make it again.
Fantastic!
This was the best fajita marinade ever. Used it on steak and shrimp.
It was so juicy and I left it marinating in the fridge over night. Turned out delicious.
Love the recipe! The flavor was greatâ€¦ Make sure and marinated overnight!
This "Fajita Marinade I" was quite good: liquid smoke is the charm. I also added some cayenne and cumin. I really wish I had of left out the water. Thank you Robbie Rice for sharing your recipe.

Used this marinade for both chicken and steak. Served to our small group. Got rave reviews. The chicken was quite spicy though I added far less black pepper than the recipe suggests. (I did use the suggested amount of cayenne pepper.) I suggest letting chicken marinate for only a short time as it seems to soak up the flavors pretty intensely. Definitely a keeper.

Very easy marinade to assemble and it tastes great! I decreased the water and added cumin, along with onion powder. I also seasoned the meat with fajita seasoning from the Fiesta line of seasonings. The taste rivaled the preseasoned fajita meat from HEB in Texas!

I love this recipe, a double the lime juice, substitute beef stock for the water. I also add 1/3 orange juice and I zest the limes for more lime flavor. I make this recipe every 2 or 3 weeks at home. Also I use wood chunks on my grill for even more smoky flavor to the outside skirt steak i use. I found most importantly that it must marinate over night for that real authentic taste and tenderness of the meat. I know some may argue the liquid amount but it's marinade for the meat. the meat takes only a few minutes to cook.

The only thing I had that was different, was smoked garlic. Trimmed, and wet down with olive oil in the smoker. This garlic is tender, moist and smoky. The skin falls right off. This was absolutely a keeper (recipe) for Fajitas!
Used Daleâ€™s marinade instead of soy sauce and decreased garlic to 2 large cloves as Daleâ€™s has garlic in it.
excellent marinade no changes needed

I use this recipe on a regular basis. The only change I make is that I don't add the water. Even if I don't have two hours to marinate the food, it still makes it taste yummy in a few minutes, but best if you can give it time.
Used the marinade to finish cooking the meat and veggies after browning. Best ever Fajitas

I had avoided trying to make fajitas for years, afraid they would be to hard to make well. This marinade made great tasting fajitas easy! I work a lot so I put some pre-cut stir fry meat into the marinade on Thursday for dinner Friday evening. Leaving only veggie prep for Friday. I cooked the meat first then removed it from the cast iron skillet I was using to cook the onions. The onions deglazed the pan nicely, becoming coated in the cooled down marinade, then I added the bell peppers and extra marinade to finish cooking, adding the meat back to come up to Temp after the rest was cooked and the marinade and juices had formed a thick sauce. Heaven!

We loved it but next time we will make some of the adjustments other reviewers suggested such as adding cumin, cilantro, and a bit more cayenne. We also used the same marinade for the peppers and onions and grilled them over the fire. Sliced them before serving and made a great home fajita meal!

This is a keeper. Followed the recipe and marinated the flank steak for about 6 hours. It was delicious! Will definitely use this again. I served with a fresh salsa and corn tortillas. Light and tasty - perfect for summer!
I made it exactly as written except that I marinated the vegetables also. My family loved it both times I made it.
The family LOVED this recipe. Used a flank steak and marinated overnight, it was delicious!
It's very spicy but good. I would adjust spices according to taste
I added a bit of cumin (never heard of smoke flavoring) and increased garlic - awesome and spicy! Definitely on our favorites list!
So delicious
Turn out fantastic. The whole family had good things to say about the flavor. So Iâ€™m not changing anything about it.
The recipe is easy to do and the lime really tenderized the steak. However, I thought there was Not enough flavor.
I made Fajitas with out using a frozen package for the first time. I followed a marinade recipe for chicken and this one for beef (I had bison in the freezer so used that) The family loved it.

This is a great Fajita marinade! definitely a keeper!
I added a few more spices, some cumin and a little coriander, extra cayenne for a little bit more heat, and instead of water, I used beer. it turned out amazing! Thanks for sharing
Followed directions to a T. Didnâ€™t really care for the soy sauce in it. Itâ€™s not a taste for fajitas that I would recommend.
Fantastic flavor. Added 1/2 tsp of Cumin and marinaded 10 hours. Everyone loved the flavor on the beef fajitas. Thanks!!
Delish!

I really liked this. Cooked it as is - no substitutes. Marinaded overnight. Super yummy and easy. Not authentic fajita flavor but really good nonetheless. In the future Iâ€™ll make some modifications to more my liking but I call this one a win. Finished dinner half an hour ago and I keep grabbing little bits out of the fridge to snack on.

Won a Fajita cookoff with this recipe! Spicy, flavorful, clean. The only change I made to the recipe was fresh squeezed lime as opposed to lime juice. Also, used thin sliced chicken breasts and was sure to not overcook.
My family thought these were great but I found the marinade to be too thin and watery. I think I'll try again with less water.
My family thought these were great but I found the marinade to be too thin and watery. I think I'll try again with less water.
Made exactly as stated. Marinated for over 8 hours. So good. I Definitely my go to to fajitas! Love it and thank you.
Wonderful easy recipe! I marinade the chicken and then put it in the freezer bag and label it . Easy dinner prep and the flavor is amazing!
This has to be the most terrible fajita marinade I've tasted! It was nothing like a real fajita. Never making again.
very flavorful and easy to make!

This is a great recipe and I wouldn't change a thing. I used with chicken and marinated 24 hours. 
The amount of marinade this recipe makes will work for 1 to 1.5 lbs meat.
The best marinade for fajita! Better than any Mexican restaurant!
My family loves this!
A DEFFINENT MUST DO FOR NEXT HOME GATHERING. ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC. Prepared exactly as the recipe said. THANK YOU

I've made this a few times and I don't change a thing, except that I only use about half the marinade for chicken. About 15 minutes before grilling, I pour the other half on mixed veggies: 1 each of red, yellow, and orange peppers, 1 red onion, 8 oz of halved mushrooms, and 2 zucchini, quartered lengthwise and cut into 1/2" thick pieces. Seriously: Save some for your veggies; you won't be sorry!
Very good, added fresh cilantro, fresh garlic. Quick and easy, yummy
Excellent! I made the recipe minus the water. I marinated meat and vegetables (separately), skewered them and made fajitas on a stick. Great flavor!
I marinated the meat for 8 hours at least and it was very tender. I used more lime and lemon than requested, but otherwise I followed the recipe.
I added some red wine instead of water. Never added water to a marinade before so didn't try here. Turned out good. Thanks.
instead of liquid smoke I chose to use Dale's liquid seasoning. You can also substitute for the lime juice, apple cider vinegar as an extra special flavor!

This was amazing! Only my second time cooking steak, so I was nervous, but it worked out very well. I did make a few substitutions. We generally eat paleo, so I subbed in coconut aminos for the soy sauce. Instead of plain water, I used bone broth. (We had freshly-made beef broth, but chicken would probably work just as well.) At my 7-year-old's request I used cumin instead of cayenne, since she was afraid it would be too spicy. It was delicious that way, but I might try sneaking in some cayenne next time anyway. ;-) I marinated four top sirloins for 24 hours, let them rest for an hour, then seared them on the stovetop. I cut it into chunks, then used some for that night's dinner and divvied the rest up for future fajita meals. Delicious, and so easy. Will definitely make again! Thank you!

Halved the water, used a ceramic skillet and marinated the meat for 1 1/2 hours.
Came out GREAT, huge hit. Will try and marinate longer next time, and there will absolutely be a next time. Served with Mexican rice (rice a roni) and refried beans, guac, chopped gr. onions and cilantro. Cheese and sour cream and flour tortillas as well as salsa and some habanero hot sauce made this one of the best meals we've had in awhile. (also we used tri tip bottom sirloin for the meat)
Great recipe! Thank you!!

I am a vegan and found this a great starter base for a fajita marinade. It works well for my veggie blend of onions, red, green, yellow and jalapeÃ±o peppers, zucchini and/or yellow squash, and tofu (black beans work as well). As per many review suggestions, I lessened the water by half, the cayenne by at least half, used only a few drops of liquid smoke, and upped the lime to our family's taste. I also added a generous shake of both cumin and coriander, and fresh cilantro. I felt the recipe wasn't flavorfully complete as written and needed the changes made, therefore the four star rating. That said, the recipe, with changes, turned out a restaurant quality 5 star marinade!!
Great marinade. I only marinated my meat for 2 hrs. Next time I will do it all day.
The only flavor that came through was the liquid smoke.

Terrific marinade. I didn't change anything. I had some sirloin steak and didn't have skirt steak. I was worried it wouldn't come out tender but it did a fantastic job. Great flavor. Lime is not overpowering at all. I will try this again on chicken.
Excellent marinade! I've been using this for months - my picky husband likes it and my kids devour it when I make fajitas. This is the only recipe I will go to for my fajitas. Thanks!
This is simply hands down THE BEST!!!! I personally added a little cumin and a slight more Cayenne.... This is a keeper THANK YOU!!!

Every time I've made this for company , they've raved. We grill our meat after marinading it and then slice it up. I once did add a quarter teaspoon of cumin to the veggies and it was delicious. I did what other reviewers said and reduced the water.
Don't be afraid of using the water, with fresh lime juice, the flavor still comes through. Add 1tsp of cumin. Would make again
added a variety of other spices
I didn't like the liquid smoke in this. I was hoping for restaurant style fajitas. This definitely wasn't restaurant style fajitas. I won't be making this recipe again.
This is delicious. My daughter the picky eater liked this. I did marinade it for about four hours. Might try overnight to see how that taste. Looking forward to trying it with chicken.
We really liked it a lot! I made half the recipe, and followed the directions to the letter. I will definitely make this again!

Finally a good fajita recipe. We have tried hundreds from packets, pre made sauces, and just cooking chicken with salsa. We love this marinade. We grilled the chicken, Nd have eaten these fajitas every week since we found it.
Very flavorful marinade, with the right amount of heat to cut through a tortilla and toppings. Made as stated, it's great! Thanks for the recipe!
This is a FANTASTIC marinade! I marinated both chicken and beef in this. Grilled them both and it was simply perfection!
Made with chicken tenders. Added cilantro, chili powder & cumin. Served from this sight Heathers Cilantro, Black Bean & Corn Salsa on the side. Nothing better.

I used this with flank steak to make beef fajitas. The combination of flavors was good. I did add some lime zest to kick up the lime flavor a bit. Next time I would add a bit more cayenne for a little more kick and leave out the water as it did seem to mute the flavors.
As long as you reduce or eliminate the water. I wash the meat and just drop it into the marinade wet. Otherwise another good spice option is to add a thinly sliced jalapeno
Great recipe! I add the bbq 3000 spice from Penezy spices and cilantro and I didn't add water.
Perfect every time! I only use this marinade now.
Yes, this will be my go-to fajita marinade. It was great and easy!
Absolutely loved this marinade!! I eliminated the liquid smoke and added a little more cayenne pepper. Grilled the steaks and sautÃ©ed some onions and peppers. What a delicious quick and easy dinner!
